column5: I left Sturgeon Falls @ 7:00 am Saturday morning with the family with a few stops an the way made our way to BPS arriving @ 10:15 am..we did good time.  I shopped 'til my heart was content all the while keeping my eyes peeled   for an OFNer... I spent 2.5 hours in there and didn't spot anyone nor was I approached by any.  Final bill of sale was 402.06$.  With my OFC hat in hand,I then made my way to Chuck-E-Cheese's for lunch and games with the kids.. We all had a great time.  We then jumped in the car to make our way up to the 400 Market  ( I missed the Essa Rd exit.. sorry BrianB)  After a pony ride for Megan at the 400 we made our way inside to buy some home decor stuff and junk.  After walking around in the market for a while .. we ended up sitting down for a break.  A booth caught my eye  .. It was a tackle shop.  I walked in and guess what was written on the wall???  here's a picture.   I really felt like I was being set up for something  As I turned around to look for a camera crew..a guy came up to me and said " I read your post and figured you'd be rolling through at anytime so I just drew up this sign 10 minutes ago"  It was "CHEAP TACKLE" a board member here on OFC and owner of the tackle shop.  I then went back to the car to get the OFC hat and presented it to him.     WOW!!!  OFC IS EVERYWHERE!!!!  All in all we had a fantastic time yesterday and the next time I go down ..I'll bring another OFC hat along and see if I can actually meet a OFNer at BPS.  Randy
OFC IS EVERYWHERE  that's pretty funny, with the sign
Great story Randy! I remember the time I walked into the post office and saw my name on the wall... got the heck outta there!
That's too funny! I was going to hit up the bass pro on my way up to my buddies cottage but unless the traffic is bad we'll be long gone before 9 AM.

I was going past Bass Pro on Wednesday and wanted to stop but the limo service driver said he wouldn't but  he did say he would slow down so I could jump out on the 400.  Obviously he thought his passengers were more important than fishing, what a poor attitude.
haha I love these forum threads. It restores my faith in humanity. Thanks for the feel good story Randy.

Randy it was a pleasure to meet & chat with you and your family.  Muchas Gracias for the hat - it's on display until I have a moment of weakness & start wearing it (don't wanna ruin the new hat look all at once!) Hope you can stop by again at the end of the month!  Michael
Good stuff!  I;ve run into fellow OFNers at various gas stations and rest stops around Ontario too - its a plague I tells you!
ingenious way to meet other OFC'rs Randy.  Love it.
By the time we hit the road we were running late, I didn't pass BPS until 11:30 and I was supposed to be in Oro Medonte at 12:00 to pick up the boat.

Now maybe for the next time ... I can get T.J 's dad to give me another hat.  What do you guys think of a "Meet Randy from Sturgeon @ BPS and learn how to swear in French and get a free OFC hat" contest???  Randy
if you pick up my boat trailer from sturgeon falls marina on saturday  i'll gladly meet and  buy you all the chuckie cheese you can eat lol
